title: Are most popular young adult novels poorly written? - Quora

response.answer_text: Are most popular young adult novels poorly written? In my experience – and in my opinion, obviously – no. In fact, I consider Young Adult novels to be better written, overall, than most other genres. Examples of outstanding YA novels: The Abhorsen Trilogy and Clariel, by Garth Nix.His Dark Materials Omnibus, by Philip Pullman.The Diviners, by Libba Bray.Seraphina, by Rachel HartmanGraceling, by Kristin CashoreShadow and Bone, by Leigh BardugoThe Raven Boys, by Maggie StiefvaterRed Queen, by Victoria AveyardMiss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children, by Ransom RiggsCinder, by Marrissa MeyerThe Paper Magician, by Charlie N. HolmbergThe Graveyard Book, by Neil GaimanThe Queen of the Tearling, by Erika JohansenThere are many others, but this should get you started.

As in terms of using 'smart' words and meaningful dialogue or plots, most of them are. In my opinion they are made to be read for fun, although some teach you important lessons in life or make you think more in general. Reading YA doesn't make you any more clever but isn't completely useless. As long as YA isn't the only kind of books a person reads, it's fine. I used to read a lot of books of the aforementioned genre but then I realised that they are all pretty similar. I still read them for fun, but nothing more than that.

I wouldn’t say that…..majority of the popular young adult novels are quite decent but that really depends on what genre you prefer. You might be picky about details and story line. If a book is good or bad……that isn’t factual but rather entirely opionated just like movies, sports, food etc… It’s not wrong to like or dislike any book…Your entitled to your won opinion anywhere.

Some are, some are not. A young adult novel by definition is one that features a young person as a main character. If they were not good stories (regardless of writing style), nobody would read them. Robert Heinlein, Grand Master of science fiction and author of a lot of what were called “juveniles” at the time, said that the key was to “Write a great story and take the sex out.” Now that’s not so much of a rule anymore.
Not all I written poorly. The best ones I read were the Harry Potter series. And the worst ones are the 5th Wave series.
